Description: Amulet of Nephthys: an opaque yellow-glass plaque of roughly oval shape having on the obverse, in high relief, a representation of Nephthys seated on the ground, her legs bent under her. She is shown with the right hand raised and held in front of her face. The hieroglyph of her name on top of her head is incomplete. Made in a worn mould.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Andrews, 'Amulets of Ancient Egypt' (1994): fig.66
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Walter Llewellyn Nash (Executors of)
